page.title: 11Summer Visitors.
page.content: Every summer lots of visitors come to Cornwall for their holidays.Many travel by car and they often tow caravans behind them.On Saturdays in summer,especially during July and August,Indian Queens,Fraddon and St. Columb Road are choked by traffic trying to get through to other places in Cornwall and to Newquay. Others going the other way are trying to get home.The local people get very annoyed because it is difficult to get about because of the traffic.There is supposed to be a by pass road going to be built in a few years time,and then the cars will not have to come through the village and everyone will be glad. Some people take in holidaymakers to earn some extra money.
